get.description: Get the list of catalog items available for a customer.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

post.description:
Get the pricing information for a customer's catalog items.
Call us to disable pricing visibility for a customer.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

get.description: Get the list of all configured platforms for a customer.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

get.description: Get the list of all your customers.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

post.description: Validate a PlaceOrderRequest before using the PlaceOrder endpoint.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

post.description: Place an order for one of your customers.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

get.description: Get the list of all available platforms.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

post.description:
Get the list of all platforms associated to the provided Skus.
Specifying multiple language tags in Accept-Language header will generate translations for each of them.
CultureInfo.InvariantCulture ("iv") is used as a fallback when language tags were not provided or not supported.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

post.description:
Get the list of required parameters for selected platforms.
Specifying multiple language tags in Accept-Language header will generate translations for each of them.
CultureInfo.InvariantCulture ("iv") is used as a fallback when language tags were not provided or not supported.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

get.description:
Get the amounts that one of your customers owe you for a specific billing period. There are three types of charges that are included in the data returned: recurring, usage, and setup.
For the time being, you cannot use the Service Provider API rebilling feature (GetReceivableCharges endpoint) while having a PSA integration enabled.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Specify a date within the desired billing period. Format: yyyy-MM-dd (UTC). Default: Today. For example, if the date is March 17th and your billing period is from the 1st to the 31st of the month, it will return data from March 1st to March 31st.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

get.description: Get the list of subscriptions details for one of your customers.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

get.description:
Get the list of subscription pricing information for one of your customers.
Call us to disable pricing visibility for a customer.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

post.description: Amend subscription quantities for one of your customers.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

post.description: Cancel subscriptions for one of your customers.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

get.description: Track the status of a request (order, amendment, cancellation, ...).

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Specify language (and culture) following [RFC 7231, section 5.3.5: Accept-Language].

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. This specification encourages that, when
dereferenced, it provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]).
When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence
of the problem, except for purposes of localization(e.g., using proactive content negotiation; see[RFC7231], Section 3.4).

status.description: The HTTP status code([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

extensions.description:
Gets the System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 for extension members.
Problem type definitions MAY extend the problem details object with additional members. Extension members appear in the same namespace as other members of a problem type.

billingCycle.description:
A billing cycle, also referred to as a billing period, is the interval of time between billing statements.
Although billing cycles are most often set at one month, or one year, they may vary in length depending on the SKU.
Possible values: monthly, yearly, once

commitmentTerm.description:
The duration for which the catalog item must be kept and paid for once purchased.
An open commitment term means it is not tied to a commitment period.
Possible values: monthly, yearly, biennial, triennial, open

isProratable.description: Indicates whether or not the price of the charge is proratable.

Charge.description: A product is constituted of one or multiple charges.

ChargeType.description:
Setup (occurs only once and can be used for activation, cancellation or setup fees),
Recurring (invoiced on a monthly or yearly basis),
Usage (varies based on the quantity of the product or service consumed by the customer),
Unknown (charge type not found. This may happen when querying data from older invoices).

CommitmentTermType.description: Represents the commitment term types for a subscription.

extensions.description:
Gets the System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2 for extension members.
Problem type definitions MAY extend the problem details object with additional members. Extension members appear in the same namespace as other members of a problem type.

CommitmentTermViolationsProblemDetails.description: The quantity cannot be decreased because it is on a commitment. Please contact us to have it adjusted. A penalty may apply.

CommittedMinimalQuantity.description: The date until which the subscription quantity may be decreased down to this minimal quantity

Currency.description:
Undefined,
Cad (Canadian Dollar),
Usd (US Dollar),
Eur (Euro),
Gbp (British pound sterling).

orderedOn.description:
Format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.fffffffK (UTC). Example : 2023-11-21T20:27:05.7613888
When no value is provided, the time of the request is used.

recurringFee.description: The recurring amount charge every cycle

setupFee.description: The initial amount charge at the end of the first cycle

billingCycle.description:
A billing cycle, also referred to as a billing period, is the interval of time between billing statements.
Although billing cycles are most often set at one month, or one year, they may vary in length depending on the SKU.

OneTime (charged once, with no recurrence),
Monthly (charged monthly),
Yearly (charged yearly).

ReceivableCharges.description: All charges to pay for a billing period.

billingCycle.description:
A billing cycle, also referred to as a billing period, is the interval of time between billing statements.
Although billing cycles are most often set at one month, or one year, they may vary in length depending on the SKU.
Possible values: none, daily, weekly, monthly, yearly and unknown

termEndDate.description: The last day of the commitment term

committedMinimalQuantities.description:
The dates until which the subscription quantity may be decreased down to those minimal quantities.
Subscription amendments and renewals impact the results. For example, a monthly subscription is
bought with 10 licenses on feb 1st, and on feb 2nd an amendment +5 is made. The CommittedMinimalQuantities
on feb 2nd would give the possibility to decrease down to 0 until feb 8 (the end of the initial grace period),
and down to 10 until feb 9 (the end of the amendment grace period).

SubscriptionCommitmentTerm.description: Null for subscriptions that are not tied to a commitment

recurringFee.description: The recurring amount charge every cycle

setupFee.description: The initial amount charge at the end of the first cycle

SubscriptionFees.description: Null for subscriptions that have no corresponding catalog item

SubscriptionOneOrMoreConstraintViolation.description: A subscription requires at least one of another subscription.

billingCycle.description:

Although billing cycles are most often set at one month, or one year, they may vary in length depending on the SKU.
Possible values: none, daily, weekly, monthly, yearly and unknown

renewalDate.description: The first day of the next commitment term

scheduledQuantity.description: In the absence of a ScheduledQuantity, the subscription will renew with the existing quantity

SubscriptionRenewalConfiguration.description: Null for subscriptions that will not auto-renew at the end of the commitment term
